intro: Lasianthus rigidus, commonly known as the rigid lasianthus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically purple or violet in color, arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some horticultural settings.
